Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the Quran does not permit the survival of non-Muslims.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the idea that jihad will continue until all Hindus, Christians, Buddhists, and Atheists are killed.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to substantiate the statement made by Abdullah Zuber.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes the problematic assumption that all Muslims share the ideology described by Abdullah Zuber.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for the fabricated quote, such as the intention to sow distrust and fear of Muslims in Congress.
Falters at times: The claim falters in providing accurate information, as it attributes the false quote to Abdullah Zuber instead of Abdullah Juber.
Understate: There is no understatement bias present in the claim.
